com.snamp.hosting

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snamp.AbstractAggregator
      • com.snamp.AbstractPlatformService
        • com.snamp.hosting.Agent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Aggregator, PlatformService, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class Agent
extends AbstractPlatformService
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Represents SNAMP hosting agent that provides interoperability between adapter and connectors.

    This class accepts the SNAMP configuration and instantiates necessary adapters and connectors, and provides communication between them. An instance of this class should be created once per calling process.

    Also, this class is an entry point for embedding SNAMP into your application.

    //restores the configuration from the file
     final AgentConfiguration config = ConfigurationFormat.YAML.newAgentConfiguration();
     config.load(fileStream);
     try(final Agent ag = new Agent(config.getHostingConfiguration())){
       ag.start(config.getTargets());
     }

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Roman Sakno

      • reconfigure

        public final void reconfigure(AgentConfiguration.HostingConfiguration hostingConfig)
        Reconfigures the agent.

        You should call stop() before invocation of this method.

        Parameters:
        hostingConfig - A new configuration of the adapter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - hostingConfig is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Attempts to reconfigure agent in the started state.

        Starts the hosting of the instantiated adapter and connectors.
        Parameters:
        targets - The configuration of connectors.
        Returns:
        true, if agent is started successfully; otherwise, false.
        Throws:
